thread.title: Spanish union eyes legal action after Ryanair talks break down - memo

title: Spanish union eyes legal action after Ryanair talks break down - memo
text:
May 11, 2018 / 10:48 AM / Updated 9 minutes ago Spanish union eyes legal action after Ryanair talks break down - memo Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
DUBLIN (Reuters) - Spanish pilots’ union SEPLA said it planned to file a lawsuit against Ryanair ( RYA.I ) over contracts in Spain, after breaking off negotiations with Ryanair management over a union recognition agreement. FILE PHOTO: A Ryanair Boeing 737-800 plane taxis at Lisbon's airport, Portugal April 24, 2018. REUTERS/Rafael Marchante/File Photo
“We regret to inform you that, at today’s meeting, the negotiations with Ryanair’s management have been broken off as they have not accepted our minimum requirements document, 90 percent of which corresponded to their proposals,” SEPLA said in a newsletter to members.
SEPLA said Ryanair did not want to allow union members three days a month to carry out union duties.
Ryanair did not immediately comment on the SEPLA talks. Reporting by Conor Humphries; Writing by Victoria Bryan; Editing by Caroline Copley
